text:
Hello, I have a question regarding the forms in HubSpot. When someone translates a form ...does HubSpot create an additional form completely separated from the one in the original language? or is there a connection between both?
For exemple for the translated one I can't see any connection to the one in the original language. Am I wrong?
I would like to grab all the forms from the api and save the ids in an external DB.

Yes i have posted my question to community and got the answer. please check
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/Facing-issue-with-Contacts-Archive-batch-API/m-p/361323#M35540>

Hi, not sure if this is the correct channel to post this, but I was wandering when is the V3 API will allow CRM get with property history? I am very anxious to start using it, but I can't without property history....

Is there an API endpoint that mirrors the "Folders" UI functionality @ *Marketing > Email > Manage > Folders*? It looks like the UI is hitting this endpoint: `<https://api.HubSpot.com/cosemail/v1/emails/folders/tree>`

Hi there!
As I see on <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/analytics/reporting> - *reporting API is currently under development.*
So my question is: Where I can find reporting API docs & examples?
I need them to build own graphs for different types of reports that will be based on Grafana and some datasource.
can you paste the error you’re seeing?
Hi Jon, it’s just the common command not found error.
I think I need to understand how a real command looks like to fetch it.
It sounds like you don’t have the CLI installed first, OR you may have another CLI tool using the `hs` namespace.
if you enter `hs help` what do you get? (you don’t need to paste everything, it’s just a command that should print out the available commands)
I get the same error. I think you are right. I thought I could just fetch everything and that would also install CLI.

Give this a shot then try fetching. Let me know if you have any further questions or hit any snags. :slightly_smiling_face:
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/developer-reference/local-development-cms-cli#install>

Even after running the installation, no luck. I got this warning after installation: Hi, I got this warnings after install: found 4 high severity vulnerabilities
  run `npm audit fix` to fix them, or `npm audit` for details
Antonios-MBP:hs-troops antonioguedes$ npm audit
npm ERR! code EAUDITNOPJSON
npm ERR! audit No package.json found: Cannot audit a project without a package.json
Using Visual Studio, btw. And the folder I’m trying to fetch is the Marketplace, which I saw other ppl had some issues with.
very strange.  was there more to the security vulnerabilities messaging?  I’m wondering if you have an outdated version of npm possibly.
I started a new installation yesterday. How can I check the version?
I’m a little bit confused now on the order of events, would you mind copying and pasting the terminal’s log (you can DM it in-case path names might expose client names or portal IDs)
